result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Lee Kopacz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight time.   Sentence credit for 2 days were granted.  TIME SERVED.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
DNA Surcharge waived.
To be paid at $50.00 per month commencing on 12/01/2015 or penalty of 2 days Huber for non-payment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas Lee Kopacz in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. 

COUNT#1: 

JAIL: 2 days (2 days credit)

COSTS: $243.00 (to be paid at $50/month commencing on 12/01/15, alternate is 2 days jail with Huber)

DNA SURCHARGE: WAIVED.
  
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Thomas Lee Kopacz in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discovery needed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Thomas Lee Kopacz did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Menden advises she has a conflict with this case, a new attorney to be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Thomas Lee Kopacz in court.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not wish to get an attorney and wishes to proceed today.  Defendant has a protective placement in place and lives in a group home.  Court advises the defendant to speak with an attorney.  Defendant to go to the public defenders office and then return to court. Defendant returns, he is able to get a public defender.

efendant to have no contact with victim/witness or the residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. He may go back to the residence only with a officer present to get his property.
